discussion.content: Shouldn't the answer be: \1@conf\.pod8\.test\.lab instead of \1@conf.pod8\.test\.lab? Why isn't there a slash before the period beginging with pod8?

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
Actually, none of the answers are valid. I plugged this into the expression tester on my Expressway C in my lab, and the alias does not match the regex pattern.

comments.content: The problem is the apostrophe pipe ( '| ). The apostrophe isn't a valid character in REGEX, and the pipe specifies a logical OR. BUT, assuming the regex pattern was: (7508.*)@expc1a\.pod8\.test\.lab, then the answer would be C as verified by the expression tester. C doesn't work due to the unescaped period in the string, and the others add extra unwanted characters to the output.
Sorry ignore this C is correct

questions.question_text: A call is sent by Cisco UCM to Expressway with a URI of 75080001@expc1a.pod8.test.lab. If (7508`¦)@expc1a\.pod8\.test\.lab.* is the pattern string, what would be the replacement string of the transform in Expressway to re-write the call so that it becomes 75080001@conf.pod8.test.lab?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Stripping @domain for dialing to H.323 numbers
 
 SIP endpoints can only make calls in the form of URIs - for example name@domain. If the caller does not specify a domain when placing the call, the SIP endpoint automatically appends its own domain to the number that is dialed. So if you dial 123 from a SIP endpoint, the search will be placed for 123@domain. If the H.323 endpoint being dialed is registered as 123, the VCS will be unable to locate the alias 123@domain and the call will fail.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/admin_guide/X14-0/exwy_b_cisco-expressway-administrator-guide/exwy_m_dial-plan-and-call-processing.html

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Calls to locally registered endpoints are failing. At present, there are two endpoints registered locally to this Expressway. An H.323 endpoint with an alias of `EndpointA` is registered, and a SIP endpoint with an alias of `EndpointB@pod1.local` is also registered. How is this issue resolved?

choices.C: The current search rule does not match the call, so the search rule must be modified to include a SIP Variant of ג€Standards-Basedג€.
choices.A: The dialplan must be redesigned to use the transforms to convert the alias into SIP URI format and then use separate search rules for each format that needs to be dialed within the local zone.
choices.B: The calls are failing because there are insufficient licenses. Additional licenses must be installed for the Expressway to route these calls.
choices.D: Calling parties are placing calls with the wrong domain. End-users must be instructed not to use the pod1.local domain as that is owned by the local system. Calls to any other domain would work.

questions.question_text: What is a key configuration requirement for Hybrid Message Service High Availability deployment with multiple IM and Presence clusters?

choices.B: You must have the Intercluster Lookup Service working across all of your IM and Presence clusters.
choices.C: Your IM and Presence Service clusters must have Multiple Device Messaging disabled.
choices.D: AXL service should be activated only on the publisher of each IM and Presence cluster.
choices.A: You must have the Intercluster Sync Agent working across your IM and Presence clusters.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
• If you have multiple IM and Presence Service clusters, you must have the Intercluster Sync Agent (ICSA) working across them.

 https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/spark/hybridservices/messageservice/cmgt_b_spark-hybrid-message-deployment-guide/cmgt_b_spark-hybrid-message-deployment-guide_chapter_01.html

Selected Answer: A
The Cisco Sync Agent must be running on the database publisher node of each intercluster peer on the local and remote IM and Presence database publisher nodes.

choices.A: The search rule must be changed to continue on match
choices.D: The underlying DNS issue must be resolved
choices.B: The existing zone using ID 7 must be deleted
choices.C: More bandwidth must be added to the appropriate pipes

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Should be D, at the end it says "Could not resolve hostname"

Looks like A to me.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/spark/212475-troubleshooting-guide-for-cisco-spark-hy.html#anc18

The general rule of thumb with Search rules is the more specific the Pattern string, the lower it can be placed in the Search rule priority list. Generally a DNS Zone is configured with a Pattern string that is going to catch anything that is not a local domain and send it to the Internet. Due to this, we recommend that you set that type of Search rule to a high priority so it's invoked last. 

It seems like a Search Rule match would resolve the "underlying DNS issue"

Selected Answer: D
D is correct.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A new neighbor zone is added for a new Cisco Meeting Server, but the zone is showing a SIP status of failed from the time the zone it was created. What should be done to resolve this issue?

choices.E: Cisco UCM zone should be either traversal server or client
choices.C: The Expressway-E must be put in a firewall DMZ segment
choices.B: The Unified Communications traversal zone should be used for MRA
choices.D: Expressway Control is the traversal server installed in the DMZ
choices.A: It is possible to NAT both Expressway-E interfaces

questions.question_text: Which two considerations must be made when using Expressway media traversal? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
• An Expressway-E located outside the firewall on the public network or in the DMZ, which acts as the firewall traversal server.

 Unified Communications features such as Mobile and Remote Access or Jabber Guest, require a Unified Communications traversal zone connection between the Expressway-C and the Expressway-E. This involves:
 ○ Installing suitable security certificates on the Expressway-C and the Expressway-E.
 ○ Configuring a Unified Communications traversal zone between the Expressway-C and the Expressway-E.

 https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/admin_guide/X14-0/exwy_b_cisco-expressway-administrator-guide/exwy_m_unified-communications.html
